result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were revoked, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Richard J Heimer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*   Pay restitution in the sum of $  TBD   plus surcharges.  State shall have 60 days to determin restitution.
*  Once restitution is determined, restitution hrg to be scheduled before Comm Dowse as requested by Atty Edwards.
Perform   40   hours of community service for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization.  May not have contact with Karyn Doran or Joan Shine, unless otherwise permitted by the court.  Senencing on Count 1 on 1/3/18 @ 8:30am.

records.addlTxt: Terminated on 3/22/18
Cash bond applied; partial refund;   jk/nr   ck#18CH080067
Per DOC Agent Erin Angel -restitution has been paid in full through DOC

Notice of Completion of Representation.
Submitted by Atty Hilary Edwards
Amended Assmt Report

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Hilary Edwards.  Clerk: PT 
Restitution has been paid and Atty Trigg objects to DE's second motion to reconsider not revoking the previous hold open agreement.   Upon hearing arguments court grants DE's motion and will not revoke the hold open agreement.  State moves to dismiss Count 1 at this time and Count 1 is Dismissed on State's motion.  Cash bond on deposit shall be applied to all costs that remain and then remaining balance of bond shall be returned to poster as requested by Atty Edwards.

Notice of Motion and Second Motion To Reconsider
Submitted by Atty Hilary Edwards
Probation extended for 1 year from 12/30/17 to 12/30/18

Motion to Reconsider is denied; Per paragraph 1 above, counsel could file this motion if restitution were paid in full.  Restitution is not paid in full; Motion is DENIED; however, if the State joins in the motion the court will reconsider.

Plea and Sentencing Hrg on 6/30/16
Sherry Bauer, Court Reporter

Motion Hearing on 12/20/17
Sherry Bauer, Court Reporter

Probation Review Hearing on 12/8/17
Sherry Bauer, Court Reporter

Notice of motion and Amended Motion To Reconsider
Submitted by Atty Hilary Edwards

To Reconsider
Submitted by Atty Hilary Edwards
DOC notified by email that deft has been extended 1 yr on Cts 2, 3 & 4.
Terminated on 12/30/17
On Counts 2, 3 & 4 - Deft's probation is extended for 1 yr from current dischage date or until all court obligations are completed.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Edwards.  Agent Erin Angel appeared in person.  Clerk/S. Garcia.  State's motion to revoke hold open agreement and probation review hearing. The court finds that there has not been a good faith effort to pay court ordered financial obligations and orders that probation is extended for one year on counts 2, 3, and 4.  Arguments heard on the motion to revoke hold open agreement for count 1.   The court finds that the defendant did not comply with the conditions of the hold open agreement and grants the state's motion to revoke.  The court enters judgment on count 1 and orders a presentence investigation.  Attorney Edwards can file a motion for the court to reconsider if restitution is paid in full.  Sentencing set for 2/13/18 @ 10:00.
Defendant's Response to State's Motion to Revoke Stipulated Hold Open Agreement - filed by Attorney Edwards

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.    Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Edwards, who arrived after the hearing due to an issue with electronic filing and not receiving notice.  Agent Erin Angel appears in person.  Clerk/S. Garcia.  Agent Angel states the defendant has not made any payments to date and that the defendant collects SSDI and is unable to work.  Agent Angel indicates that the defendant has not made a good faith effort to pay the court ordered financial obligations.  The court will set a hearing for the probation review hearing and motion to revoke hold open agreement before 12/30/17. The state's motion to revoke hold open agreement and probation review hearing set for 12/20/17 @ 2:30.
To Revoke Stipulated Hold Open Agreement

Amended Info
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge
Stipulated Hold Open Agreement - 18 months.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Richard J Heimer, appeared with Attorney Hilary D. Edwards.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification.  Amended Information filed by the State and case is resolved.  
Count 1 - DE pleads No Contest; judgment is withheld and parties enter in to a Stipulated Hold Open Agreement for 18 months.
Counts 2, 3 and 4 - DE pleads No Contest; found guilty by the court.  Sentencing arguments made.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Sentence is withheld on Counts 2, 3 and 4; DE is placed on probation for 18 months with conditions and all 3 counts are concurrent.  Restitution is to be determined and State shall have 60 days to determine restitution.  Restitution Hearing to be scheduled before Comm. Dowse if restitution is determined as requested by Atty Edwards.  As a condition DE is ordered to complete 40 hours of Community Service.  No contact with Karyn D. or Joan S. unless permitted by the court.  Court costs & Surcharge to be paid during supervision and any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Bond continues.  Appeal Rights given.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for January 3, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Richard J Heimer, appeared with Attorney Hilary D. Edwards.  Clerk: PT
Case is not resolved at this time.  Jury status hearing scheduled for June 30, 2016 at 01:00 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for July 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Atty Edwards states they are in still investigating the amount of restitution that is being sought with the pawn shop and requests an adjournment.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 15, 2016 at 09:40 am.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Hilary Edwards.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  For the reasons stated on the record by Atty Edwards, jury trial on 1/19/16 is removed from the calendar.  Status conf. set for 3/2/16 at 8:40.  Bond continued.
